issue.title: Write debian changes Date field in UTC rather than local time

repository.name: rules_pkg
repository.description: Bazel rules for creating packages of many types (zip, tar, deb, rpm, ...)

issue.body:
This fixes some subtle problems caused by having CI and developer machines in different time zones.
It's also the right thing.

body:
I think there are ways to make this fail on linux too.
If we spill args to a file instead of the command line I am seeing that a single 'é' will emit as the 4 octal bytes 303 203 302 251. 
```
é = u00E9 =utf-8=> C3 A9 =(utf-8 again)=> C3 83 C2 A9 =%o=> 303 203 302 251 
```
That's a clear  8859-1 -> UTF-8 mis-encoding.

issue.title: Possible fix for JDK20 vs. UTF8 problem

labels.name: awaiting-user-response
labels.description: Awaiting a response from the author

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This is only partial. What we really need to do is get rid of the capability for UTF-8 command line distinction. We should only write in UTF8.  And, since we are fake UTF8 in Latin1 internally, we should just dump out the bytes untouched.

And then it needs tests.

#18792

body:
This is a problem for linux also if you do it right.

https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/pull/712
- is a PR that should be good, but fails on a unicode problem only on macos with bazel at head.
- it creates an action by making an args list of a bunch of strings. When the command line gets built, the args are written just fine.

https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/pull/714 
- takes the same code base, but creates the action by doing the proper thing - calling ctx.actions.args() and using arg.append for each arg.
- it we don't force spliling args to a file. It mostly works just like 712.  
- if we do force writing the params file, it fails in many ways.

I think that the CI failures in https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/pull/714 may be a red herring: it's bug (or more likely, several bugs) in the argparse module in certain versions of python, not a bug in Bazel :/

Look at the errors in https://buildkite.com/bazel/rules-pkg/builds/2466#01890405-7614-4d1f-a408-14e3bff80a92: there is no good reason for argparse to decode the param file using ascii given that you have set PYTHONIOENCODING, PYTHONUTF8, LANG, and LC_CTYPE.

I think argparse will finally be properly fixed in python 3.12 (currently in beta) by https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/93277

But https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/pull/714 does demonstrate a Bazel failure specific to macOS: the param file (bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-fastbuild/bin/tests/deb/fizzbuzz_4.5.6_all.deb-0.params) gets incorrectly encoded.

> I think that the CI failures in bazelbuild/rules_pkg#714
<https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/pull/714> may be a red herring:
it's bug (or more likely, several bugs) in the argparse module in certain
versions of python, not a bug in Bazel :/

The argparse thing is a red herring, but that is just an additional layer
of problem.
If I look at the .params files produced I can see the bad double encoding.
So that problem is below argparse, but I don't have a good way to show that.

I just won't have time to really make a good reproduction for the error
cases until late next week.

issue.title: Fix encoding of non-ascii contents written to parameter files.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
When args are written to parameter files, non-ascii values are wrongly encoded again as utf-8. This seems to be unaffected by the JDK20 upgrade of Bazel, and has always been happening.

Repro:
```
$ cat encoding/BUILD$ cat encoding/BUILD
load("defs.bzl", "cat")

cat(
    name = "test_cat",
    out = "cat.txt",
    content = "привет",
)

sh_binary(
    name = "cat_bin",
    srcs = ["test_cat.sh"],
)

$ cat encoding/defs.bzl
def _test_cat_impl(ctx):
  args = ctx.actions.args()
  args.use_param_file("%s", use_always = True)
  args.add(ctx.attr.content)
  ctx.actions.run(
    inputs = [],
    outputs = [ctx.outputs.out],
    arguments = [args, ctx.outputs.out.path],
    executable = ctx.executable.cat_bin,
  )

cat = rule(
  implementation = _test_cat_impl,
  attrs = {
    "out": attr.output(mandatory = True),
    "content": attr.string(mandatory = True),
    "cat_bin": attr.label(
      executable = True,
      cfg = "exec",
      allow_files = True,
      default = Label("//encoding:cat_bin"),
    ),
  })

$ cat encoding/test_cat.sh
#!/bin/sh
cat "$1" >> "$2";

$ bazel build //encoding:test_cat
$ cat bazel-bin/encoding/cat.txt-0.params
'Ð¿ÑÐ¸Ð²ÐµÑ'
$ cat bazel-bin/encoding/cat.txt
'Ð¿ÑÐ¸Ð²ÐµÑ'
```
